definition: to sleepwalk/to journey in a dream
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: The question is:Is the sleepwalker actually awake or asleep?
sentences.chinese: 問題是，夢遊者實際上是清醒的還是仍在睡覺呢？

sentences.english: In fact, sleepwalkers can sustain injuries if they continue to walk around.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，如果夢遊者繼續四處走的話會受到傷害。

sentences.english: Somnambulist's memories snooze through the whole event.
sentences.chinese: 夢遊病患者的記憶打瞌睡是通過整個事件形成的。

sentences.english: Last night I dreamed of traveling to Paris and seeing Notre-Dame de Paris.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我夢遊巴黎，在夢中我看到了巴黎聖母院。

sentences.english: A somnambulist can happily combine sleep and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 夢遊者能把睡眠和運動巧妙地結合在一起。

sentences.english: Sleepwalking is one of the disturbances of consciousness that fall in the scope of psychopaths.
sentences.chinese: 夢遊症是精神病中意識障礙的一種。
夢遊病者做最奇怪的事。
醒着的夢遊，真實的自我。

sentences.english: The best idea is to gently guide the sleepwalker back to bed.
sentences.chinese: 最好的方法是溫和的將夢遊者帶回牀上。

sentences.english: He had lost all that dreamy vagueness and indecision.
sentences.chinese: 過去的夢遊似的迷迷糊糊和優柔寡斷早已不在。

sentences.english: And yet we're sleepwalking into this brave new world.
sentences.chinese: 而我們則夢遊着來到這個勇敢的新世界。

sentences.english: I always suspect that I have somnambulism.
sentences.chinese: 我一直懷疑自己有夢遊的習慣。

sentences.english: Sleepwalking episodes can last from a few seconds to half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 夢遊的過程可以持續少至幾秒鐘多至半小時。

sentences.english: Thee book is often referred to by the abbreviated title Alice in Wonderland.
sentences.chinese: 這本書是常被縮寫名稱“愛麗絲夢遊仙境。

sentences.english: She told him she hurt her foot while sleepwalking!
sentences.chinese: 她說自己是在夢遊的時候把腳弄傷的。

sentences.english: Both bore languidly the indefinable burden of immaterial pleasures. Thus lived these somnambulists who are called lovers.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個所謂情人的夢遊病患者便是這樣過活的。

definition: talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to dream about (sth or sb)/to see in a dream
to dream/to have a dream/fig. illusion/fantasy/pipe dream
to talk in one's sleep/crazy talk
